definition: to hunch over/to stoop/to arch one's back (upward)
a bow (weapon)/CL:張|张[zhang1]/to bend/to arch (one's back etc)
the back of a body or object/to turn one's back/to hide something from/to learn by heart/to recite from memory/unlucky (slang)/hard of hearing
to be burdened/to carry on the back or shoulder

sentences.english: The horse twisted and bucked and finally dismounted its rider.
sentences.chinese: 那匹马扭动并猛然弓背跃起把骑手摔下马。

sentences.english: The wild horse bucked its second rider off.
sentences.chinese: 野马猛然弓背跃起，把第二个骑手摔下了。

sentences.english: This wild bronco bucked its rider in just ten seconds.
sentences.chinese: 这匹野马仅10秒钟就弓背跃起把骑者摔了下来。

sentences.english: Hold and slowly return. Avoid arching your back.
sentences.chinese: 维持几秒并慢慢恢复起始位置，避免弓背。

sentences.english: Press down on the mat with your hands, gently increasing the arch in your back.
sentences.chinese: 这时，双手紧压地面，轻轻向后弓背，增加弧度。

sentences.english: I remember wooden chairs with arched backs and spindles.
sentences.chinese: 我记得木制椅子的弓背和转轴。

sentences.english: The donkey bucked when it saw the snake.
sentences.chinese: 毛驴看见蛇时，猛然弓背跃起。

sentences.english: He backflipped off a bucking horse.
sentences.chinese: 他从一匹猛然弓背跃起的马上后空翻落下。

definition: to bow/to bend at the waist
to bend/to curve around/curved/crooked/to wind/to warp
to bend the body at the waist/to bow
